ABOUT_TEXT: sBotics is a simulation platform designed to emulate various world-famous robotics competitions, where kits are commonly used to perform the required actions. This platform offers an alternative for those seeking to test and improve their skills in the field as well as being able to test programs without the risk of damaging physical parts.
GOOGLE_PHOTO: Publicly available on Google Street View
WELCOME_MESSAGE: Start developing in the programming area.
TUTORIAL_MESSAGE:
Use the mouse buttons or the 
indicated keys to control the camera
TUTORIAL_DESCRIPTION: Questions while using the simulator? Click on the book icon at any time.
POSITIONING_TEXT: Use ↑, W, ↓, S, A, ←, D e → to move the robot in different directions. Use Z, X, C, V e B to move the actuator in different directions. Positioning speed:
IMPORTED_FILE_MESSAGE: The file {0} was imported. All saved changes in file will be automatically loaded in program {1}.
LOGIN_ERROR_429: Você excedeu o limite de tentativas. Wait a while try again later.
ROUTINE_REPORT_DESCRIPTION: To review the report, it's necessary to run the routine at least once.​
PERFORM_SCAN: Press shift to perform the scan
CBOTICS_TOS:
This is the cBotics competition module.
To continue, please make sure you are participating in an active competition at http://cbotics.weduc.natalnet.br. Then generate your competition code for the round you wish to participate in and paste it in the space below. Make sure you have saved, compiled and tested your program as many times as you think necessary before participating in the official round.


After continuing and confirming the information in the next step, you CAN NOT reverse this operation.


By continuing you agree to the terms of the competition in which you entered. We are not responsible for the misuse of the system or for automatic disqualifications caused in the cBotics system by code plagiarism, attempts to circumvent the systems or use of personal account by third parties.


Good competition!
TOC_AGREE: I agree to the Terms of Competition
TUTORIAL_ARENA_MARKERS: Right-click on the field to add an object; Click on an object to edit its position, press the button again to confirm the new position or click with the left mouse button to delete it.
NO_ATTEMPTS_LEFT: Your attempts for this course section are over, would you like to proceed to the next checkpoint or keep trying without scoring any additional points?
NO_ATTEMPTS_LEFT_END: Your attempts for this course section are over, would you like to finish or keep trying without scoring any additional points?

ACTUATOR_FUNCTIONS_FORKLIFT:
• raise(number)
• lower(number)
• turndown(number)
• turnup(number)
• open()
• close()
CHANGED_ROBOT: Warning! Your robot has been changed and you may need to modify your code.
PASTE_ARENA_CODE: Paste the code and press the ">>" button
ARENA_REQUIRES_CHECKPOINTS: This arena requires checkpoints. Add them before testing the routine.
BLOCKEDUC_DISCLAIMER:
To program in BlockEduc, choose the program you want to modify or create a new one. Then, click on the "Start programming" button and the blockeduc editor will open on your computer.


You will need to compile your program before testing.
CURSOR_TUTORIAL: Use ↑, W, ↓,S, ←, A, → and D to move the purple cursor.
LINES_DISCLAIMER: We were not able to find a route for the end tile. Thus, the option "Robot has to follow line" is disabled and many rescue line features wont work properly. If you want to re-enable it, reorganize the arena until this message disappears. If what you're building is not a standard Rescue Line arena, uncheck this option in the Advanced settings.
BLOCKEDUC_NOT_FOUND: BlockEduc app not found, make sure you have the latest sBotics version installed
BLOCKEDUC_CHECK_DUPLICATES: Check whether or not you already have BlockEduc open on your computer.
BLOCKEDUC_EXTRACTION_ERROR: BlockEduc couldn't be extracted for block programming. Opening the directory for manual extraction (do not delete any files, just unzip the zip file).
UNEXPECTED_ERROR: An unexpected error has occurred. Try again.
CHECK_CONNECTION: Check your internet connection and try again.
GENERIC_ERROR: Your code has an error. Suggestion: check for the usage of prohibited characters.
FILE_EMPTY: The file cannot be empty. Write something before saving and try again.
UNABLE_TO_COMPILE: We were unable to compile your code. Try again or contact us for further help.
SOMETHING_WRONG: There's something wrong with your code. Tip: Try verifying the usage of functions with inadequate returns or innapropriate structures.
KEYWORD_VIOLATION: Error: use of the {0} reserved word. Tip: perform a check on the names of variables and tasks.
PERCEIVED_LIGHT: Perceived light values from light sensors:
PERCEIVED_COLOR_VALUES: Perceived color values from color sensors:
PERCEIVED_VICTIM: Presence of victim in the actuator:
